speaker: Sage Sign
text: This island was once a home to the most splendid fields of wheat, whoose splendor was comparable to the rising sun

speaker: Sage Sign
text: The village, far away from the continent, was peacful and harmonoius, unembroiled in the ongoing wars and cataclysms

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Until the famine 5 years ago, the worst one in the last millenium.

speaker: Sage Sign
text: The peace was broken. People raided their niegbours and ravaged their granaries for even the most meager morsels of food.

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Some even practiced cannibalism and started hunting others

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Seeing this the village chief sought out his advisors: the recluse warlock and the blacksmith to revitalize the dying earth

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Though the blacksmith was killed before he could put his plans into motion, the warlock succeded in developing an instant growth fertilizer

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Unfortunately, the only thing it worked on was pumpkins, but it was still much better than eating your fellow brethen.

speaker: Sage Sign
text: ...Or so they thought

speaker: Sage Sign
text: After eating the pumpkins to show the safety and ingenuity of his invention, the warlock started to morph

speaker: Sage Sign
text: His limbs twisted and strethced, his skin became roots. As for his head it became a pumpkin

speaker: Sage Sign
text: The chief, seeing the warlock turn into a monster tried to run be he was caught by the beast and dragged to it's home, far, far away from the village

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Few brave souls, that have yet to succumb to madness tried to rescue him, yet none of them ever came back

speaker: Sage Sign
text: Since then, every waxing moon a new scarecrow appears in the village, bearing an uncanny resemblance to the locals, and an unprecedented thirst for flesh

speaker: Sage Sign
text: As for the warlock, he's still at his lair. Killing any of the remaning villager, or rather cannibals, and using them for his experiments

speaker: Player
text: Don't care, didn't ask. Tell me how to get to the boss so that I can get out of here.

speaker: Player
text: Oh, also if you know of any more strong foes I could best, that would be for the best

speaker: Sage Sign
text: ...To get to his lair just follow the spiral layout of the island...

speaker: Sage Sign
text: ...Maybe go to the templar cementary on the continent...

speaker: Player
text: Ok, thanks, bye bye
